TopicTitle: [1.1.2] KSPRC - Renaissance Compilation: artworks remake [V-0.7 Pre Release 3]

Articles.Content:
Hello! MatoroIgnika suggested I make WindowShine Compatible with KSPRC (And I was already wanting to), so I did it.

Installation:

1. Install KSPRC

2. Install WindowShine

3. Overwrite TextureReplacer with this: KSPRC+WindowShine (Dropbox)

- Edit: Proot, also note that there are a few textures that are still .dds in parts. I think the Gigantor is one of them.

I did what you said but, I dont think it works.

- Edit - I couldnt install WindowShine on stock ksp either. Seems like Im doing something wrong.

Edited June 30, 2015 by qromodynmc

Okay, Proot has allowed me to share my config, and here is it! https://www.dropbox.com/s/ow9h5fspmm1eerl/KSPRC_Kopernicus.zip?dl=0

Unzip the contents of the .zip into your GameData folder and delete the KittopiaSpace and RealSolarSystem folders. They aren't needed anymore.

Hello Thomas, can you please explain further how to get all of this to work on 104?

I download the original .90 mod, then delete KittopiaSpace folder and apply your file? Do I need Kopernicus mod and/or RSS?

Thank you!

You need to download KSPRC v0.2 and install it into your GameData folder. Update PlanetShine and DistantObject, and then delete the KittopiaSpace folder and the RealSolarSystem folder. Then, you unzip the contents of my patch (i.e. Kopernicus/- and KSPRC/- folders) into your GameData. You don't need anything else.

Sorry Thomas, but no donut

Game loads fine (new game) but whenever I click on any building at ksc, I get the bug where nothing else is clickable, not even able to back to main menu.

You need to install TextureReplacer too before WindowShine. Was that possibly the issue? I but an insert above the download.

Try installing just texturereplacer and adding the KSPRC texturereplacer files in. That should work.
And delete .dds Loader!

Did both and it worked, thank you.

Now the question is, how do I get this to work with RSS?

When you said "Delete RSS folder, is no longer necessary" I thought the mod was already included, however the planet is small stock, not RSS.

Update: Tried installing RSS + 8K textures. It loads alright and the planet still looks fantastic, however I have flickering horizon ghost textures and the sky looks bad.

Edited July 1, 2015 by JeeF

I've installed this mod and had the same trouble as Jeef. I've been able to rectify the freezing by deleting the DDSLoader folder altogether, and reinstalling Planetshine's latest version and Texture Replacer separately and then importing files.

However, I still have two main glitches,

1) Kerbal's helmets are fogged/glazed over. You can kinda see through them, but it's obvious that it isn't supposed to look that way. They're orange, with a faint, fuzzy point of light reflected, and, well, glazed like a donut.

2) When going into orbit, around 50-60k, the sky goes from having an almost stock color arrangement, to a the high orbital 'atmo blue' haze that is actually quite strong, and makes all the land look blue as well, so that when de-orbiting, I really have to look hard to see that I'm landing on land, and not water. It's a very abrupt color shift. While the effect of more atmo is cool, I am not sure if this was the intended effect, or if something has gone wrong.

I already had Engine Lighting, Mechjeb, EVE, Planetshine, and Astromoner's pack installed. I just overrode all the files, but I'm going to try it on a clean install this evening. I'll let you know if that clears it up.

Joe, many thanks for your offerings, but I already have clouds and parts basically done.

Let's see a pic of Kerbin's moons, Mun and Minmus. Comparison:

-snip-

Oh good. The Mun was way too dark. Also, Minmus seems less edible now. Not sure if that's a good thing.

Just for french people who search here for keeping KSPRC working.

Traduction of the French method :

Problem of dll, the procedure was badly made. Here it is again for the maj 1.0.2 ( or 4 ) :

- Once KSPRC downloaded, to unzip it somewhere on C: then, inside, suppress files RealSolarSystem, DDSLoader and KSP_Data.

- Download PlanetShine, DistantObject and TextureReplacer in their lastest version.

- For each of these mods, copy plugin (file dll) in their respective file, in the KSPRC file.

- Put the file KSPRC in Gamedata of your KSP

- Enjoy!

You can forge that you want in Texture to Replace and to personalize the mod as you please.

___________________________________________

Edited July 2, 2015 by iDInkeD06

I was able to get rid of the fuzzy texture for the visor helmets by deleting any references to visor helmets in my Default folder under Texture replacer.

One final thing I have noted is there is no camera lens flare when looking at the sun. The sun just appears as a white sphere with absolutely no effects for it. Is this intentional? If not, hmm..

1) Kerbal's helmets are fogged/glazed over. You can kinda see through them, but it's obvious that it isn't supposed to look that way. They're orange, with a faint, fuzzy point of light reflected, and, well, glazed like a donut.

This is not a glitch I don't believe...it's due to the file EVAVisor.png in TextureReplacer/Default/ folder. Proot has changed the texture of the visor on EVA. The fuzzy point of light is the sun reflecting off it and that's a Texture Replacer bug I believe...reflections not working properly on the Intro/Start screen.

2) When going into orbit, around 50-60k, the sky goes from having an almost stock color arrangement, to a the high orbital 'atmo blue' haze that is actually quite strong, and makes all the land look blue as well, so that when de-orbiting, I really have to look hard to see that I'm landing on land, and not water. It's a very abrupt color shift. While the effect of more atmo is cool, I am not sure if this was the intended effect, or if something has gone wrong.

I believe it's always been like this, the Atmo looks really thick and really blue shifts the colors from orbit.

I was able to get rid of the fuzzy texture for the visor helmets by deleting any references to visor helmets in my Default folder under Texture replacer.

One final thing I have noted is there is no camera lens flare when looking at the sun. The sun just appears as a white sphere with absolutely no effects for it. Is this intentional? If not, hmm..

If you installed the sharedassets file that was packaged with the download, you removed it. I believe there is mention of this issue in the OP or somewhere within the thread, but the sunflare was moved from the old location in either .90 or 1.0 (can't recall which). You need to either grab the texture out of the sharedassets file provided by Proot and put it in the correct one, or just leave the sunflare alone for now. To get your old sunflare back, you will have to replace the sharedassets file provided in the download with the original file.

Still no lens flare, still dull, matte, glazed over visors. Back to the drawing board on this.
